I don't want to start another "holy war"...  just presenting another POV:

if your production classes are located unter a src/ directory, just 
mirror your hierarchy in a test/ directory.

you will have then: src/edu/washington/library/Book.java
and your test in  : test/edu/washington/library/BookTest.java

You will be able to test your public interface, striped them when 
dealing with the release but you will be able to:
- test your protected methods
- easily generate Javadoc with Ant (as far as I know, the Javadoc Ant 
task can't deal with FileSets, so it's impossible (?) to only include 
your production classes in your javadoc documentation)

You can have a look at some really well organized projects (those of 
Jakarta for example - http://jakarta.apache.org) and see by yourself.

But it's a matter of taste.

-Vladimir
